main.description: A collage illustration showing a mouth with two black shapes representing distorted speech bubbles.

children.data: disinformation and misinformation are often used interchangeably. But there is a subtle difference in their meaning. Disinformation is when false information is spread with the intent to deceive, often as part of a co-ordinated campaign. Misinformation
is when false information is unintentionally spread, for instance by repeating a rumour to a friend or reposting an unsubstantiated claim on a social-media platform.
is not a new phenomenon, but social media and artificial intelligence (
making it easier to spread lies

. A disinformation campaign might try to sway voters in the run-up to an election, turn social groups against one another, undermine scientific research, discredit a business or manipulate share prices. As technology makes the spread of false information ever more complex,
—and the language used to talk about disinformation is changing.

parts.headline: What are the rules governing protests on American campuses?
parts.description: They vary, and are hard to enforce

parts.headline: Who is jamming airliners’ GPS in the Baltic?
parts.description: Russia seems to be the culprit, but it may be inadvertent

parts.headline: What are the obligations of Israel and Hamas to protect civilians?
parts.description: International Humanitarian Law creates obligations—but contains numerous caveats

parts.headline: Why is so much of the internet’s infrastructure run by volunteers?
parts.description: Malware smuggled into XZ Utils software highlights a bigger problem

parts.headline: The growing role of fighting robots on the ground in Ukraine
parts.description: Drones already fill the skies. Now uncrewed vehicles are heading to the front lines

parts.headline: Why do cicadas have such a strange life cycle?
parts.description: Two broods will soon emerge simultaneously for the first time in 221 years

parts.headline: How a home-improvement subsidy is wrecking Italy’s public finances
What is geoengineering?
parts.description: Deliberately cooling the climate is an unsettling idea

parts.headline: Why are embassies supposed to be inviolable?
parts.description: Ecuador’s raid on a Mexican embassy challenges a central principle of diplomacy
